subject: Sexual Health
title: Sperm Production
description: A fast breakdown of Sperm Production for builders.

hook.text: Men produce about 1,500 new sperm every single second. That is roughly 130 million per day.

buildup.text: Sperm are made in the testes through a process called spermatogenesis that takes about 74 days.

discovery.text: Temperature matters. The testes hang outside the body because sperm production requires cooler temperatures.

twist.text: Unlike women, men keep producing sperm throughout life, but quality and motility decline with age.

climax.text: Understanding sperm production helps men protect and optimize their fertility at any age.

punchline.text: 130 million a day, every day, for decades.

quiz.question: Why do testes hang outside the body?
